logging

class LogManager

Object
  |
  +--logging.LogManager

class LogManager
extends Object

The LogManager provides a hook mechanism applications can use for loading the logging.xml file which applications can use. The global LogManager object can be retrieved using LogManager.getInstance(). The LogManager object is created during class initialization and cannot subsequently be changed.


Author:
Ralf Siegel

Method Summary

addPropertyChangeListener ( listener: IPropertyChangeListener ): Boolean
Registers a property change listener with the log manager.

Returns the Filter object associated with the class with the given string name

Returns the Formatter object associated with the class with the given string name

public static
createPublisherByName ( className: String ): IPublisher
Returns the Publisher object associated with the class with the given string name

public
disableLogging ( ): Void
Disables logging (logging is enabled by default) for all loggers.

public
enableLogging ( ): Void
Enables logging (logging is enabled by default) for all loggers.

public
getDefaultPublisher ( ): IPublisher
Gets the default publisher, which usually will be the trace output.

public static
getInstance ( ): LogManager
Get the singleton instance.

public
onPropertiesRead ( ): Void
Proxy handler which will be invoked when properties are read. It then will forward the event to all registered property change listeners.

public
readProperties ( propertyFile: String ): Void
Convenience method to start reading the external logging properties. The method is supposed to be invoked by an application's main class on startup as part of the hook mechanism. Make sure you have registered a listener before in order to proceed.

public
removePropertyChangeListener ( listener: IPropertyChangeListener ): Boolean
Unregisters a property change listener from the log manager.

addPropertyChangeListener

public function addPropertyChangeListener(listener: IPropertyChangeListener): Boolean
Registers a property change listener with the log manager.

Parameters:
listener
The listener object to be added
Returns:
true if listener was added successfully, otherwise false.

onPropertiesRead

public function onPropertiesRead(): Void
Proxy handler which will be invoked when properties are read. It then will forward the event to all registered property change listeners.

readProperties

public function readProperties(propertyFile: String): Void
Convenience method to start reading the external logging properties. The method is supposed to be invoked by an application's main class on startup as part of the hook mechanism. Make sure you have registered a listener before in order to proceed.

Parameters:
propertyFile
A file location which contains logging properties

removePropertyChangeListener

public function removePropertyChangeListener(listener: IPropertyChangeListener): Boolean
Unregisters a property change listener from the log manager.

Parameters:
listener
The listener object to be removed
Returns:
true if listener was actually removed, otherwise false.
